oai_dc:dc.dc:title: Letter of William Baldwin to Sir Thomas Cawarden: Private Letter
oai_dc:dc.dc:subject: Performance
oai_dc:dc.dc:description: Letter from William Baldwin to Sir Thomas Cawarden, describing the play 'The Way to Life'. The play was composed c 1555-6(?), negotiations undertaken with Inns of Court but not played (?)

In his letter to Sir Thomas Cawarden c 1555–6 (?), Baldwin claims to ‘have made a Commodie concernyng the way to lyfe’ appropriate for performance before the queen (Mary); moreover, ‘there be of the Innes of court that desyer to have the setting furth therof.’
The letter appears originally in Inns of Court Vol. 1, p. 80, lines 7-28.
oai_dc:dc.dc:contributor: Jakacki, Diane REED London Jakacki, Diane Katherine, 1964-07-27 (Editor)
